>  How is that not breaking?
Because you can’t see it.
The package manager stops you seeing any change to the API.
So you don’t get any errors about using the wrong API
Things that can not be observed can not be breaking

text:
The reason it should be minor  if greater than 1.0
is
1. Everything that is not a bug fix (patch), or a breaking change (major), is minor
2. Having it minor means you are open to backporting things for old julia versions using patch release on old version number.
